Digital Logic.question: Consider Z = X – Y, where X, Y and Z are all in sign-magnitude form. X and Y are each represented in n bits. To avoid overflow, the representation of Z would require a minimum of __________. (GATE CSE 2019)
In 16-bit 2’s complement representation, the decimal number -28 is __________. (GATE CSE 2019)

Consider an eight-bit ripple-carry adder for computing the sum of A and B, where A and B are integers represented in 2′s complement form. If the decimal value of A is one, the decimal value of B that leads to the longest latency for the sum to stabilise is ________. (GATE CSE 2016 Set 2)
The 16-bit 2′s complement representation of an integer is 1111 1111 1111 0101; its decimal representation is __________. (GATE CSE 2016 Set 1)
The smallest integer that can be represented by an 8-bit number in 2′s complement form is ___________. (GATE CSE 2013)

We want to design a synchronous counter that counts the sequence 0−1−0−2−0−3 and then repeat. The minimum number of J−K flip-flops required to implement this counter is ________. (GATE CSE 2016 Set 1)
The minimum number of JK flip-flops required to construct a synchronous counter with the count sequence (0,0,1,1,2,2,3,3,0,0,…) is _________. (GATE CSE 2015 Set 2)
Consider a 4-bit Johnson counter with an initial value of 0000. The counting sequence of this counter is _______. (GATE CSE 2015 Set 1)

Consider the following representation of a number in IEEE 754 single-precision floating-point format with a bias of 127. S: 1 E: 10000001 F: 11110000000000000000000. The decimal value is ________ (rounded to 2 decimal places). (GATE CSE 2021 Set 1)
Let the representation of a number in base 3 be 210. What is the hexadecimal representation of the number? (GATE CSE 2021 Set 1)
